wikipedia_page.main: Robert Washington Shirley, 13th Earl Ferrers,  (8 June 1929 – 13 November 2012), styled Viscount Tamworth between 1937 and 1954, was a British Conservative politician and member of the House of Lords as one of the remaining hereditary peers. He was one of the few people to serve in the governments of five prime ministers.

response: * 8 June – Robert Shirley, 13th Earl Ferrers, politician (died 2012)
* Robert Shirley, 13th Earl Ferrers (1929–2012), British peer and politician
**Robert Shirley, 13th Earl Ferrers, 83, peer, Deputy Leader of the House of Lords (1979–1983, 1988–1997).
*Robert Shirley, 13th Earl Ferrers, 83, British peer, Deputy Leader of the House of Lords (1979–1983, 1988–1997).Earl Ferrers

Earl Ferrers was born on 29 September 1952. He was educated at Ampleforth College, Ampleforth, Yorkshire, England. He succeeded to the title of Earl Ferrers upon the death of his father, Robert Shirley, 13th Earl Ferrers, on 13 November 2012.
* East Anglian Silver: 1550–1750, edited by Christopher Hartop with foreword by Robert Shirley, 13th Earl Ferrers, exh. cat.
